error.signature: TypeError: function() takes 0 positional arguments but 1 was given
error.regex: TypeError: \w+\(\) takes \d+ positional argument.* but \d+ (was|were) given

verdict.summary: Too many arguments passed. Common: missing self in class method, or calling staticmethod wrong.

dead_ends.why_fails: Hides the real issue â€” wrong number of args means a bug

dead_ends.action: Remove extra arguments from the call
dead_ends.why_fails: May work but check if the function signature is wrong instead

workarounds.action: If class method, add 'self' as first parameter
workarounds.how:
class Foo:
    def method(self, x):  # not: def method(x):

workarounds.action: If decorator issue, check @staticmethod vs @classmethod vs regular method
